data.enText: an organization for helping people in need

data.chText: 许多慈善机构捐款赈济饥民。
data.enText: Many charities sent money to help the victims of the famine.

data.chText: 这场音乐会将为当地慈善机构募捐。
data.enText: The concert will raise money for local charities.
the aim of giving money, food, help, etc. to people who are in need

data.chText: 大多数人参加伦敦马拉松赛跑是为慈善事业募集资金。
data.enText: Most of the runners in the London Marathon are raising money for charity .
Do you give much to charity?
a charity concert (= organized to get money for charity)
to live on/off charity (= to live on money which other people give you because you are poor)
kindness and sympathy towards other people, especially when you are judging them

data.chText: 她的文章对她以前的朋友毫不宽容。
data.enText: Her article showed no charity towards her former friends.
you should help and care for your own family, etc. before you start helping other people

simple_means.memory_skill: char 可爱的 + ity 具备某种性质，状况 → 慈善

ex.chText: 他对窃贼很仁慈，放他走了。
ex.enText: He showed mercy to the thief and let him go.
He knelt down and begged for mercy.

synonyms.bx: 指对有权处置或惩罚之人表现出的慈悲或怜悯。

ex.chText: 邻居们被她的善举深深感动了。
ex.enText: Her neighbours were deeply moved by her works of charity.

ex.chText: 社会舆论对他毫不宽容。
ex.enText: Public opinions showed him little charity.

synonyms.bx: 指对他人表现出的仁慈或同情。

ex.chText: 她对穷人表现出了强烈的同情。
ex.enText: She showed strong compassion for the poor.

ex.chText: 他满怀同情地和她讲话。
ex.enText: He talked to her with compassion.

synonyms.bx: 指对某人遭遇的极大同情，并意欲提供帮助，多含褒义。

ex.chText: 那些孩子永远也不会忘了她的好意。
ex.enText: Those children will never forget her kindness.
She always treats people with kindness.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指对他人的友好举动。

data.enText: you should help and care for your own family, etc. before you start helping other people

tr: an activity or gift that benefits the public at large
a kindly and lenient attitude toward people
an institution set up to provide help to the needy
a foundation created to promote the public good (not for assistance to any particular individuals)
pinnate-leaved European perennial having bright blue or white flowers

value.def: A charity is an organization which raises money in order to help people who are ill, disabled, or very poor.

example.ex: The National Trust is a registered charity.
example.tran: 全国托管协会是个已注册的慈善机构。

value.def: If you give money to charity, you give it to one or more charitable organizations. If you do something for charity, you do it in order to raise money for one or more charitable organizations.

example.ex: He made substantial donations to charity...
example.tran: 他为慈善事业捐了很多钱。

example.ex: Gooch will be raising money for charity.

value.def: People who live on charity live on money or goods which other people give them because they are poor.

example.ex: My mum was very proud. She wouldn't accept charity...
example.tran: 母亲自尊心很强，不会接受施舍。

example.ex: Her husband is unemployed and the family depends on charity.
example.tran: 她丈夫失业了，全家人靠救济金过日子。

value.def: Charity is kindness and understanding towards other people.
If you say charity begins at home, you mean that people should deal with the needs of people close to them before they think about helping others.

trans: 凯瑞迪·布巴吉；查利蒂·布巴奇

partsOfSpeech.dec: car 可爱的 + ess 表女性 → 女性最需要爱抚 → 爱抚
char 可爱的 + isma → 可爱的东西 → 魅力
char 可爱的 + it + able …的，charity的形容词 → 慈善的
char 可爱的 + ity 具备某种性质，状况 → 慈善
char 可爱的 + m → 魅力
cher〔= char〕可爱的 + ish 使… → 珍爱
